unit.name: Warlord
unit.description: Equipment: Hand weapon and heavy Armour. Special Rules: Lead From the Rear.

unit.name: Grey Seer
unit.description: Magic: A Grey Seer is a Level 4 wizard. Equipment: Hand weapon and D3 Warpstone Tokens. Special Rules: Lead From the Rear.

unit.name: Vermin Lord
unit.description: Magic: This model is a Level 4 wizard. Equipment: Doom Blade. Special Rules: Terror, Large Target, Immune to Psychology, Stubborn, Ward Save (5+), No Leader.

unit.name: Battle Standard
unit.description: Equipment: Hand weapon and heavy Armour. Special Rules: Lead From the Rear.

unit.name: Chieftain
unit.description: Equipment: Hand weapon and heavy Armour. Special Rules: Lead From the Rear.

unit.name: Plague Priest
unit.description: Magic: A Plague Priest is a Level 2 wizard. Special Rules: Frenzy.

unit.name: Warlock Engineer
unit.description: Magic: A Warlock Engineer is a Level 1 wizard. He knows the BM Warp Lightning spell. Equipment: Hand weapon and 1 Warpstone Token. Special Rules: No Leader.

unit.name: Assassin
unit.description: Equipment: Additional hand weapon and throwing stars. Special Rules: Scout, Dodge (4+), Slinking Advance, Concealed, Skaven Assassin.

unit.name: Clanrat
unit.description: Equipment: Light armour and shield. Special Rules: Anti-Cav (spear).

unit.name: Stormvermin
unit.description: Equipment: Halberd and heavy armour. Special Rules: none.

unit.name: Night Runner
unit.description: Equipment: Additional hand weapons and throwing stars. Special Rules: Light Infantry, Slinking Advance.

unit.name: Skavenslave
unit.description: Equipment: Hand weapons. Special Rules: Expendable.

unit.name: Giant Rat
unit.description: Equipment: Whip (Packmaster only). Special Rules: Rat Pack, Wave of Rats.

unit.name: Rat Swarm
unit.description: Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: Skirmish, Unbreakable (Swarm), Small, Expendable.

unit.name: Plague Monk
unit.description: Equipment: Additional hand weapons. Special Rules: Frenzy.

unit.name: Gutter Runner
unit.description: Equipment: Additional hand weapons and throwing stars. Special Rules: Scouts, Skirmish, Dodge (6+), Slinking Advance.

unit.name: Poison Wind Globadier
unit.description: Equipment: Poison Wind Globes. Special Rules: Skirmish.

unit.name: Jezzail Team
unit.description: Equipment: Jezzail, light armour and Pavise. Special Rules: none.

unit.name: Rat Ogre
unit.description: Equipment: Whip (Packmaster only). Special Rules: Fear (Rat Ogres only), Frenzy, Beast Pack.

unit.name: Plague Censer Bearer
unit.description: Equipment: Plague Censer. Special Rules: Skirmish, Frenzy, Hatred.

unit.name: Warp Lightning Cannon
unit.description: Warmachine: 3 Crew. Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: Warp Lightning Cannon.

unit.name: Plagueclaw Catapult
unit.description: Warmachine: 3 Plague Crew. Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: Plagueclaw Catapult.

unit.name: Doomwheel
unit.description: Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: Doomwheel, Impact Hits (D6), Terror, Large Target, Immune to Psychology.

unit.name: Hell Pit Abomination
unit.description: Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: Hell Pit Abomination, Impact Hits (D3), Terror, Stubborn, Immune to Psychology, Large Target, Regeneration (4+).

mount.name: Screaming Bell
mount.description: The Screaming Bell is accompanied by 1 Rat Oger. Special Rules: Fear, Large Target, MR (2), Screaming Bell.

mount.name: Plague Furnace
mount.description: The Plague Furnace is accompanied by 3 Plague Monk Crew. Special Rules: Fear, Large Target, MR (2), Plague Furnace.

mount.name: Pox Rat
mount.description: Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: Poisoned Attacks (1), Pox Rat

mount.name: Rat Ogre Bonebreaker
mount.description: Equipment: Hand weapon. Special Rules: Fear

item.name: BM Foul Cloud
item.description: (9+) Direct Damage, all units within 12" may be affected, enemy units are automatically affected, Skaven units on a 4+ and clan pestilens units on a 5+, the caster itself is immune to the spell effects, all affected units suffer D6 S4 no AS hits

item.name: BM Pestilence Breath
item.description: (8+) Place tear drop template touching the caster in its front arc. All models hit suffer a S3 no AS hit. If the caster is in cc, select one enemy unit that is in btb with the caster, this unit suffers D6 S3 no AS hits.

item.name: BM Plague
item.description: (11+) Hex, Range 24", RIP. When the spell is successfully cast as well as at the start of each players magic phase, the target suffers D6 S3 no AS hits.

item.name: BM Searing Doom
item.description: (10+) Direct Damage, Range 24", place the center of the 3" template within 24", for each hit (see Templates in core rules) the unit suffers a S4 hit, allocated like shooting. A unit that suffers at least one casualty has to take a panic test.

item.name: BM Vermin Tide
item.description: (7+) Magic Vortex. Place 3" template touching the caster then move the template 4D6" in any direction in the casters front arc. Every unit touched by the template (except caster) suffers 3D6 S2 hits.

item.name: BM Wailing Warpstorm
item.description: (8+) All Flyers have to half their flying movement (i.e. usually 10") and all non- magical ranged shooting suffers -1 to to-hit rolls. The effect last until the casters next magic phase.

item.name: BM Warp Lightning
item.description: (7+) MM, Range 24", D6 S5 hits, for each natural 1 on the to-wound roll, roll a D6: on a 1-2 the model suffers a wound with no saves of any kind.

item.name: BM Wither
item.description: (8+) Hex, Range 18", target unit suffers -1T and -1I until the casters next magic phase.

item.name: Banner of Burning Hatred
item.description: Unit gains Hatred (even if ItP). If the unit is not engaged in cc and didnt declare a charge, roll a D6 at the start of each own compulsory movement phase: 1-3 the unit has to immediately move as fast as possible towards the closest enemy in LOS and cannot move in the remaining moves phase, 4+ unit can move normally in the remaining moves phase.

item.name: Banner of the Four Black Winds
Banner of the 4 Black Winds
Banner o.t. 4 Black Winds
item.description: Flying models trying to charge this unit have to use their ground movement characterstic.

item.name: Banner of the Swarm
Banner o.t. Swarm
item.description: Outnumber bonus for this unit is +2CR (instead of +1CR).

item.name: Beast Pack
item.description: - The unit consists of Rat Ogres and Packmasters. Fill ranks with Rat Ogres first then with Packmasters. If the unit comprises a single Rat Ogre, the unit may form a formation with a frontage of less than 60mm. - Randomise ranged hits between Rat Ogres (1-5) and Packmasters (6). - If no Packmasters are left in the unit, then the unit suffers from Stupidity. - In cc Packmasters do not have to step up as long as there are enough Rat Ogres left for all remaing Packmasters to be placed behind (i.e. ratio of 2 Packmasters: 1 Rat Ogre). - Packmasters are ignored for determining rank bonuses. - If all Rat Ogres are slain, the unit is destroyed. If the unit is destroyed in close combat, Packmasters destroyed in this way do not count towards combat resolution. - Characters cannot join this unit.

item.name: Biting Blade
item.description: AP(1)

item.name: Blade of Corruption
item.description: Each model that suffered a wound by this weapon has to roll a D6 at the beginning of each of its own turns, 1-3: the model suffers 1 wound with no AS.

item.name: Brass Orb
item.description: Place the center of the 3" template anywhere within 8", scatter and resolve hits as for a stone thrower (point of impact only deviates half the artillery dice), if a misfire is rolled center the template on the bearer, models hit suffer 1 hit at a strength equal to 8 minus their initiative (to a minimum of S1). Causes D3 wounds to Large Targets. One use only.

item.name: Cautious Shield
item.description: Shield. 1 model in btb loses 1A or the bearer may declare at the start of the combat to make the model lose 2A by not attacking in this combat. Skaven player may choose which model and which attack(s).

item.name: Concealed
item.description: Instead of deploying this model during setup, it can start the game concealed in any one of the following units: Clanrats, Stormvermin, Night Runners, Gutter Runners. No more than one model can be hidden in a unit. An Assassin does not count to the limit of character models per unit but no more than one Assassin may be part of a unit (hidden or not) at any time. The Skaven player may reveal the Assassin at the start of any of his turns or at the start of any combat phase. When the Assassin is revealed place it in btb with the enemy (cc) or in the front rank of the unit (when the unit is not in cc). If possible, a rank and file model of the unit is placed in the back of the unit to make space, if not a character model may be moved. If the unit, the Assassin is hiding in, is destroyed before the Assassin is revealed, the Assassin is lost and counts as a casualty. A concealed Assassin cannot be damaged in any kind of way.

item.name: Crown of the Horned Rat
Crown o.t. Horned Rat
item.description: Regeneration (4+)

item.name: Cursed Blade of Delirium
item.description: grants the bearer WS10

item.name: Death Frenzy PM 2/7+
Death Frenzy PM 3/7+
item.description: Augment, Range 18". The unit gains Frenzy. If the unit already has Frenzy, it gains Death Frenzy which works like Frenzy but grants +2A (instead of +1A) and causes D3 Wounds with no saves allowed to this unit at the start of each players close combat phase. The effect of the spell ends when the spell is dispelled/cancelled or the unit is defeated in combat. The spell has no effect on character models. Remains in Play.

item.name: Dispel Scroll
item.description: Automatically dispels one spell without the need of DD. One use only.

item.name: Doom Blade
item.description: Magical attacks, causes D3 wounds

item.name: Doom Flayer
item.description: Instead of attacking normally in close combat, the model inflicts a number of hits equal to an Artillery Dice at S4 to one unit in its front (Skaven players choice), distribute like impact hits. In addition, the model is -1 to hit in cc. Misfire: model suffers 1 wound which counts for combat resolution.

item.name: Enchanted Shield
item.description: Shield that grants +2 AS

item.name: Expendable
item.description: This unit does not cause panic in friendly units, unless they are Expendable themselves.

item.name: Hell Pit Abomination
item.description: Random Movement (3), with the following exceptions: If this model contacts one of your own units that unit suffers D3 S6 hits and this model is positioned 1" away facing in a direction of your choice. This model flees 3D6+1" and pursues 3D6".

item.name: Jezzail
item.description: Move or Shoot, Range 36“, S6, AP(1), Dangerous, magical attacks

item.name: Languisher Sword
item.description: Always strike first

item.name: Lead From the Rear
item.description: This character can lead from the last rank, i.e. it may be positioned in the last rank and still grants all bonuses as if it was positioned in the first rank. The character can only issue and refuse challenges if it is in btb with an enemy. If the unit but not the character is in cc, it is free to leave the unit, stay in the rear or move into base to base contact with an enemy in its movement phase.

item.name: Life is Cheap
item.description: All Skaven units may target enemy units in cc with friendly units with ranged attacks, Magic Missiles or Direct Damage spells. Effects with templates are resolved as usual, i.e. the respective units under the template are affected. The line of the Warp Lightning Cannon counts as a template for this special rule. For each hit by Magic Missiles, Direct Damage spells or ranged attacks without templates that an enemy unit engaged in cc with a friendly unit would suffer, roll a D6: on a 4+ the hit is transferred to the friendly unit the enemy unit is engaged with. If multiple friendly units are engaged with the enemy unit, randomise the hits between the respective friendly units.

item.name: Live to Fight Another Day
item.description: Skaven units flee an additional inch, i.e. usually 2D6+1".

item.name: No Leader
item.description: This model may never be the army general. Also units cannot use this models Ld for Ld-tests and this model does not allow a unit to rally below 25%.

item.name: Pavise
item.description: +2AS vs ranged attacks

item.name: Plague Censer
item.description: Counts as Flail. In addition, at the start of the each combat phase (timing 1) each model (friend or foe) that is in BtB with one or more models wielding a Plague Censer suffers a S3 hit with no AS allowed. In the case of a ridden monster/chariot both the monster/chariot and the character model suffer a hit. Wounds count for combat resolution. Models wieldung a Plague Censer are immune to this effect and suffer no hits.

item.name: Plagueclaw Catapult
item.description: Catapult, Range 12"-48", 5" template, S2(2) no AS. Units that suffer one or more wounds has to take a panic test. Misfire chart: 1-2: Destroyed, 3-4: the warmachine doesnt shoot this turn as well as the next, 5-6: the warmachine doesnt shoot this turn

item.name: Poison Wind Globe
item.description: Thrown weapon, Dangerous, Range 8“, wounds on a 4+, no AS allowed.

item.name: Poisoned Gift PM 2/7+
Poisoned Gift PM 3/7+
item.description: Augment, Range 18". The units gains Poisoned Attacks (1) in cc, if the unit already has Poisoned Attacks, increase its value by +1. Remains in Play.

item.name: Poisoned Wind Mortar
item.description: Catapult, Range 6"-36", 3" template, hits wound on 4+ with no AS allowed, the model is only allowed to use its BS when it stayed stationary. Misfire chart: 1-2: Destroyed, 3-4: the weapon doesnt shoot this turn as well as the next, 5-6: the weapon doesnt shoot this turn. 96

item.name: Power Stone
item.description: +2PD to cast a spell. Dice used may exceed maximum allowed by level. One use only.

item.name: Rat Pack
item.description: The unit consists of Giant Rats and Packmasters. Fill ranks with Giant Rats first then with Packmasters. Randomise ranged hits between Giant Rats (1-5) and Packmasters (6). If no Packmasters are left in the unit, then the unit has to charge if possible (measure after all charges have been declared if a unit is within charging distance). If the unit did not charge, it has to move full speed towards the closest enemy unit. Characters cannot join this unit.

item.name: Ratling Gun
item.description: Range 24", S4, AP(1), 2D6 shots, Dangerous, does not suffer to hit penalties for multiple shots. May stand and shoot. If the model is destroyed before the charging unit could complete its charge (e.g. because of failed Dangerous tests), handle the charge as if the charged unit fled out of reach of the charging unit, i.e. redirect or failed charge. More Dakka: Before shooting with the Ratling Gun, the Skaven player may declare to fire 3D6 instead of 2D6 shots. If two or more 6s for shots are rolled, the model is destroyed after shooting.

item.name: Ring of Darkness
item.description: MR(1)

item.name: Rust Armour
item.description: 5+ AS, if a hit does not allow an AS (because of high AS modifier or special rule) discount the hit and the Rust Armour is destroyed.

item.name: Sacred Standard of the Horned Rat
Sacred Standard o.t. HR
Sacred S of the HR
item.description: Bearer and unit cause fear.

item.name: Sacred Thirteen
item.description: Every time a 13 is rolled (after modifiers) to cast a spell (PM and BM) the spell is cast with Irresistible Force. Multiple sixes do not cause Irresistible Force (unless part of a roll of a 13). Multiple ones still count as a miscast and take precedence over a roll of a 13.

item.name: Shadow Pelt PM 2/5+
Shadow Pelt PM 3/5+
item.description: Augment, Range 18", Ward Save (5+) vs ranged attacks and spells until the casters next magic phase. Has no effect on character models.

item.name: Skalm
item.description: Restores all wounds to starting level of bearer or character in btb. Can be used at the start of any phase in either players turn. One use only.

item.name: Skaven Assassin
item.description: - All attacks made by this model (cc and ranged) count as magical and have the Poisoned Attacks (1) and Killing Blow special rules. Does not affect magic items (e.g. Brass Orb). - This model may never be the army general. Only Clan Eshin units (i.e. Night Runners, Gutter Runners, Eshin Weapon Teams) may ever benefit of its Ld.

item.name: Skavenbrew
item.description: Roll a D6 after deployment. Bearer and unit he is with gain: 1 Stupidity, 2-3 Frenzy, 4-5 Hatred, 6 Frenzy, Hatred and the unit he is with suffers D3 wounds (no AS) at the start of each of your turns. No effect on other characters in the unit. After deployment bearer cannot leave or join units. One use only.

item.name: Skitterleap PM 2/5+
Skitterleap PM 3/5+
item.description: Augment, cast on itself or friendly character model on foot with US1 (in both cases) within 12", model reappears anywhere on the table but no closer than 1" to enemy unit and not in impassable terrain.

item.name: Slings
item.description: 18", S3. Multiple shots (2)

item.name: Slinking Advance
item.description: After deployment but before the first turn is determined, the game starts the unit may make a move up to its normal Movement allowance, i.e. no march move. Cannot be used if the unit was deployed as Scouts.

item.name: Smoke Bombs
item.description: Whenever this model flees from a combat that it was fighting in alone, all units that like to pursue have to roll a D6: on a roll of 1-3: the unit is not allowed to pursue (even if it would be forced to by a special rule like Hatred or Frenzy), 4-6: the Smoke Bombs have no effect.

item.name: Staff of Sorcery
item.description: +1 to total roll to attempt to dispel a spell.

item.name: Storm Banner
item.description: Activate at the start of any turn. Flying models using their fly movement move at half speed, shooting is at -1 to hit and ranged attacks not using BS (doe not affect magic missiles) only work on a 4+. The effect ends after both players completed a turn. One use only.

item.name: Strength in Numbers
item.description: Each Skaven unit gets +1 Ld for each point of rank bonus it would get in cc up to a max of +3.

item.name: Sword of Striking
item.description: +1 to to-hit rolls in cc

item.name: Tenebrous Cloak
item.description: Ward Save (3+) vs shooting and magic missiles

item.name: The Foul Pendant
item.description: Ward Save (5+)

item.name: The Gouger
item.description: hits ignore armour saves

item.name: Tunnelling Team (special rule)
Tunnelling Team
item.description: The Tunnelling Team can opt to not setup during deployment and be held in reserve. If it does so, place a tunnel marker (25mm diameter) for it anywhere on the board after deployment but before the game starts. At the start of your second turn roll a D6, if you roll a 5+ the Tunnelling Team shows up in the remaining movement phase. If it does not show up, roll at the start of each of your following turns and add +1 to the roll for each turn after the second. A natural 1 always fails, i.e. The Tunnelling Team does not show up. When the Tunnelling Team shows up, roll the Scatter and Artillery Dice. Scatter the tunnel marker the distance rolled by the Artillery Dice in the direction indicated by the Scatter Dice. If the tunnel marker scattered of the board the unit counts as destroyed. If the Scatter Dice shows a hit symbol, dont move the tunnel marker at all. If the Artillery Dice shows a misfire, the unit does not scatter but loses D3 models (only common Gutter Runners) which does not cause a panic test. If the tunnel marker does not contact a unit, place the Tunnelling Team (including a potential accompanying Warp Grinder) completely within 3" of the tunnel marker. Models that cannot be placed without getting in contact with the board edge, impassable terrain or within 1" of an enemy unit are destroyed. If the tunnel marker ends up at least partially under an enemy unit, the Tunnelling Team (including a potential accompanying Warp Grinder) is placed in BTB with the enemy unit and counts as in close combat but not as charging, i.e. fight in initiative order. The enemy unit cannot declare any charge responses and has to hold. The Tunnelling Team is positioned on the side of the enemy unit where the highest number of models of the Tunnelling Team can be legally placed. If there are multiple such sides, place the Tunnelling Team on the side nearest to the marker (randomise if necessary). The Tunnelling Team is placed as close to the marker as possible in a formation which faces the enemy unit and maximises the number of attacking models. If there is no space to legally place all models, every model that cannot be placed on the board is destroyed. If the tunnel marker ends up at least partially under a friendly unit, the Tunnelling Team is placed exactly like in the case with an enemy unit but the units are not engaged in close combat. If the Tunnelling Team appears and is not engaged in cc, it may still move (but not charge).

item.name: Umbranner
item.description: Bearer and unit gain Ward Save (4+) vs normal and magical missiles of S4 or less.

item.name: Unreliable
item.description: All skaven units are Unreliable. Unreliable units that suffer a misfire have to roll on their misfire chart.

item.name: War Banner
item.description: +1CR

item.name: Warp Energy Condenser
item.description: Bearer may use up to 3 PD to cast spells.

item.name: Warp Grinder
item.description: The model may accompany a Tunnelling Team. If it does so the Tunnelling Team may reroll the roll to emerge and does not suffer casualties in the case of a misfire result. In close combat the model has 3A at S5, AP(1), Dangerous.

item.name: Warp Lightning Cannon
item.description: Range 8D6", hits everything in its path (draw a line as for a cannon ball) until stopped by a hill, building or rock formation. Strength = Artillery Dice, D3 Wounds, magical attacks. Misfire chart: 1-2: Destroyed, 3-4: the warmachine doesnt shoot this turn as well as the next, 5-6: roll a scatter dice, the warmachine fires in that direction with S10.

item.name: WarpfireThrower
item.description: Flamer weapon, Range 0", S4, AP(1), no stand and shoot, units that suffer one or more wounds must pass a panic test. Misfire chart: 1-2: Destroyed, 3-4: the weapon doesnt shoot this turn as well as the next, 5-6: the weapon doesnt shoot this turn.

item.name: Warplock Pistol
item.description: Range 10", S5, AP(1), Dangerous, no penalty for moving and shooting as well as long range; may always stand and shoot, even if the enemy is within half charge distance. Whip: In cc the bearer may make 1 attack through 1 rank of Rat Ogres or up to 3 ranks of Giant Rats.

item.name: Warpscroll
item.description: PM 2/5+, Direct Damage, place the center of the 3" template within 18", for each hit (see Templates in core rules) the unit suffers a S3 hit with no AS, allocated like shooting. A unit that suffers at least one casualty has to take a panic test. One use only.

item.name: Warpstone Amulet
item.description: Ward Save (4+), if a 1 for the ward save is rolled, then the amulet is destroyed (if you suffer multiple hits at the same time, you have to save one hit after the other)

item.name: Warpstone Armour
item.description: 4+ AS, each successful armour save in cc causes a S4 hit to the model that caused the respective wound.

item.name: Warpstone Charm
item.description: Bearer may reroll a single dice per game. (to-hit, towound, saving throw, characteristic test (inlc. Ld), casting and dispelling).

item.name: Warpstone Token
item.description: Before deployment determine the number of Warpstone Tokens the character starts the game with. Before casting a spell, the character may choose to use any number of Warpstone Tokens he has left to boost his next spell (may exceed limit of dice used). Each Token is used exactly like a Power Dice except that for each roll of a 1 the character loses a wound with no saves allowed. If the character dies and the spell is successfully cast, the spell still goes off. Also, dice generated by Warpstone Tokens can never be rerolled. One use only per Warpstone Token.

item.name: Wave of Rats
item.description: Giant Rats fight in two ranks.

item.name: Weapon Team
item.description: Weapon Team: - Weapon Teams are independent units, but have to be deployed with and setup within 3" of the unit the Weapon Teams was bought as an upgrade for (counts as one drop). - As long as a Weapon Team is within 3" of a parent unit it can use the parent units Ld for Ld tests. - If a Weapon Team is hit by ranged attacks it may transfer hits to a parent unit within 3" with at least 5 models left on a roll of 4+ per hit. This works like the Look Out Sir! rule (see chapter Characters in the core rules). - Parent units are: Clanrats, Stormvermin, Plague Monks, Night Runners and Gutter Runners

item.name: Weeping Blade
item.description: Poisoned Attacks (2), hits inflict D3 wounds

item.name: War Palanquin
item.description: Model gets +1AS, as well as 2 additional attacks at WS4 and S4 that do not benefit of any gear or special rules of the model. The model still counts as an infantry model with US 1 and therefore cannot be singled out by shooting (under normal circumstances). Also, when this model joins a unit, the unit counts its rank bonus as if the space the War Palanquin takes up was filled with rank and file models.
